intro: Pentacalia wilburii, commonly known as the Wilbur's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial herb that produces small, clustered flowers, often with five lobes, giving it its scientific name. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
